chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher A Bolcer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with victim.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Write apology to victim under supervision of Dept. of Corrections.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 20 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Remaining 10 days can be served on weekends over course of supervision to avoid interference with Coast Guard duties with contemplated start date after June 1. Huber privileges granted.
Perform 10 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher A Bolcer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for early discharge from probation pursuant to 973.09(3)(d)
State's Response to Defendant's request for early termination of supervision
from Defendant requesting early release from supervision. Per Court, not opposed but needs to be initiated by P.O. (after 6/27/15).

Defendant Kristopher A Bolcer in court with attorney Travis Thomas Schreurs. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of amendment of Count 2. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Kristopher A Bolcer in court with attorney Travis Thomas Schreurs. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kristopher A Bolcer in court with attorney Travis Thomas Schreurs. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Set prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on November 24, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with AH, DH. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Kristopher A Bolcer appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/10/14, 10:00.
